result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Kettenbeil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Causing Mental Harm to Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Obtain and maintain full-time employment.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.     Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  Participate in any counseling recommended by the Agent. No abusive contact with victims.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Comply with same conditions as 2. No Restitution requested.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A Kettenbeil

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Joseph A Kettenbeil in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant Joseph A Kettenbeil in custody. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Counts 2 & 5:  W/H Sentence: 24 mo probation: Costs +$250 DNA on each count, Maintain fulltime employment. Comply in any other assessments and counseling as recommended by the Agent. No abusive contact with the vicitims. No restitution requested. 6 mo jail, consecutive to what he is currently serving.  Counts 1,3, 4,6, & 7 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated with exception to the jail.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 2: No Contest
Count 5: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 & 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.  Counts 1, 3, 4, 6, & 7 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Cousins calls victim who makes supportive statements to the court and provides the Court victim statements.
ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield concurs with the joint recommendation and requests huber privileges and home monitor option.
Defendant's makes apologetic statements.

BY THE COURT:*********PROBATION**********
Count 2: W/H Sentence: 24 months Probation:  Obtain and maintain full-time employment.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.     Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  Participate in any counseling recommended by the Agent. No abusive contact with victims.  Pay costs + $250 DNA
Count 5: W/H Sentence: 24 months Probation, concurrent.  Comply with same conditions as 2.  Pay costs  + DNA surcharge.  No Restitution

12CF206: Amend JOC to include Huber privileges for employment and medical treatment.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Joseph A Kettenbeil in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant Joseph A Kettenbeil in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:02 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.
Case to be Pre-Tried today.

Defendant Joseph A Kettenbeil in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant Joseph A Kettenbeil in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:24 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Officer J. Johnson is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cousins. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 
Cross exam by Atty Redfield. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

Atty Redfield makes statements re: bond.  
BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify the bond is denied.  Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
$20,000 cash bond: No contact with Mark Ciseweski.   Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

Defendant Joseph A Kettenbeil in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joseph A Kettenbeil appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
State requests a $20,000 cash bond: No Mark Ciseweski.   Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
BTC: $20,000 cash bond: No Mark Ciseweski.   Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
